channel.title: New game from Jagex?
channel.description:
Looking at the Jagex corporate site, I noticed an opening for a "Content Developer" -
Content Developer Jagex Ltd, developer and publisher of the MMORPG adventure game RuneScape, is looking for imaginative people to join the content development team on a permanent basis. Your role will primarily be to build creatures, shape virtual worlds, design quests and storylines for our new, undisclosed game. Must have: * Previously written quests or storylines for RPG or novels * Good programming skills * Good creative writing skills and imaginative storyline ideas * Experience of working to deadlines * Passion for games * Good communication skills, able to make part of a very exciting team Also useful: * A computer science degree is a plus but not essential if good programming skills can be demonstrated * Anime, graphic novels and general sci-fi interest Candidates must provide a CV with examples of previous creative work (either emailed or a website link). Salary: £18-22k depending on experience, annual bonus, health care, gym membership and other benefits. Location: Cambridge. Candidates must be able to work in Cambridge or to re-locate. To apply: Send your CV (as Word document) with covering letter to: We will contact you directly if we wish to proceed further with your application. Interviews will be held in the Cambridge office.
If you didn't catch it the first time through: [b]Your role will primarily be to build creatures, shape virtual worlds, design quests and storylines for our new, undisclosed game.[/b] They also have more openings for team leaders, programmers, animators, recruiters, etc. than usual - looks like they're putting together a team for an entirely new branch of Jagex, honestly. Anyone know more?

item.title: New game from Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

Yes as Mopar said this was posted way before in Kaitnieks where people had false fanatasies about getting a job there and sneaking info out, I think it was eXemplar or someone.

I don’t believe it would be a new game, why would they abandon RuneScape, it is pretty successful. If anything they might shut down RS and use the same ideal for a new game with a different storyline, perhaps a more wider world with more skills techniques races etc, like WoW.

And if they are I can’t wait to see those High Score fags kill themselves

Read full topic

item.title: New game from Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t know and I don’t feel like speculating about jagex, all I do know is that if I made 30+ million a year from a game I would just stick with that one game. (truthfully I would probably quit and/or sell it after the first year, I couldn’t spend 30 million in a lifetime I don’t believe :P)

item.title: New game from Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Looking at the Jagex corporate site, I noticed an opening for a “Content Developer” -

Content Developer Jagex Ltd, developer and publisher of the MMORPG adventure game RuneScape, is looking for imaginative people to join the content development team on a permanent basis. Your role will primarily be to build creatures, shape virtual worlds, design quests and storylines for our new, undisclosed game.

Must have:

* Previously written quests or storylines for RPG or novels
* Good programming skills
* Good creative writing skills and imaginative storyline ideas
* Experience of working to deadlines
* Passion for games
* Good communication skills, able to make part of a very exciting team

Also useful:

* A computer science degree is a plus but not essential if good programming skills can be demonstrated
* Anime, graphic novels and general sci-fi interest

Candidates must provide a CV with examples of previous creative work (either emailed or a website link).

Salary: £18-22k depending on experience, annual bonus, health care, gym membership and other benefits.

Location: Cambridge. Candidates must be able to work in Cambridge or to re-locate.

To apply: Send your CV (as Word document) with covering letter to:

We will contact you directly if we wish to proceed further with your application. Interviews will be held in the Cambridge office.

If you didn’t catch it the first time through:

Your role will primarily be to build creatures, shape virtual worlds, design quests and storylines for our new, undisclosed game.

They also have more openings for team leaders, programmers, animators, recruiters, etc. than usual - looks like they’re putting together a team for an entirely new branch of Jagex, honestly.

Anyone know more?

Read full topic
